name.text: Identifying the volume of a cone

questiontext.text:
A cone-shaped funnel has a radius of {@r_cm@} cm and a height of {@h_cm@} cm. How much water can the funnel hold?

Give your answer in cubic metres.

[[jsxgraph]] const brd = JXG.JSXGraph.initBoard('jxgbox', { boundingbox: [-4, 15, 14, -3], axis: false, showCopyright: false, showNavigation: false }); // Cone dimensions const r = 7; // radius const l = 10; // slant height // Center of ellipse base const O = brd.create('point', [5, 8], {visible: false}); const a = r / 2; // horizontal radius const b = r / 6; // vertical radius (flattened for ellipse look) // Apex (tip of cone) const Apex = brd.create('point', [O.X(), O.Y() - l], {visible: false}); // Base edge points const A = brd.create('point', [O.X() - a, O.Y()], {visible: false}); const B = brd.create('point', [O.X() + a, O.Y()], {visible: false}); // Cone sides brd.create('segment', [Apex, A], {strokeColor: '#222', strokeWidth: 2}); brd.create('segment', [Apex, B], {strokeColor: '#222', strokeWidth: 2}); // Filled cone surface brd.create('polygon', [A, Apex, B], { fillColor: 'yellow', fillOpacity: 0.85, borders: {visible: false} }); // Ellipse (base) const ellipseFront = brd.create('curve', [ t => O.X() + a * Math.cos(t), t => O.Y() + b * Math.sin(t), Math.PI, 2 * Math.PI ], {strokeColor: '#222', strokeWidth: 2}); const ellipseBack = brd.create('curve', [ t => O.X() + a * Math.cos(t), t => O.Y() + b * Math.sin(t), 0, Math.PI ], {strokeColor: '#222', dash: 2, strokeWidth: 2}); // Radius line (â†”) with arrowheads on both sides const radiusLine = brd.create('arrow', [O, B], { strokeColor: '#222', strokeWidth: 2, lastArrow: {type: 2, size: 6}, firstArrow: {type: 2, size: 6} }); // Label for radius brd.create('text', [O.X() + a / 3, O.Y() + 0.3, "{#r_cm#} cm"], {fontSize: 16}); // Perpendicular (vertical) height of the cone const heightLine = brd.create('segment', [O, Apex], { strokeColor: '#000', strokeWidth: 2, dash: 1 }); // Label for perpendicular height brd.create('text', [O.X() - 0.5, O.Y() - l / 2, "{#h_cm#} cm"], { fontSize: 16, rotate: 90, fillColor: 'blue', strokeColor: 'blue' }); [[/jsxgraph]]

\(\text{Volume}=\)[[input:ans1]]\(\,\text{m}^3\)[[validation:ans1]] [[feedback:prt1]]

generalfeedback.text:
Step 1: Identify the given information

The funnel is in the shape of a cone.

Radius of the base = {@r_cm@} cm
Perpendicular height = {@h_cm@} cm

The volume is required in cubic metres, so all measurements must be converted from centimetres to metres.

Step 2: Convert centimetres to metres

\(\begin{align} r &= \frac{{@r_cm@}}{100}\ \\ &={@r_1@}\,\text{m} \\ h &= \frac{{@h_cm@}}{100} \\ &= {@h_1@}\,\text{m} \end{align}\)

Step 3: Find the area of the circular base

\(\begin{align} \text{Base area} &= \pi r^2 \\ &= \frac{22}{7}\times \left({@r_1@}\right)^2 \\ &={@base@} \end{align}\)

Step 4: Write the formula for the volume of a cone

\(\begin{align} \text{Volume of a cone} &= \frac{1}{3}\times \text{base area} \times \text{height} \end{align}\)

Step 5: Substitute the values

\( \begin{align} V &= \frac{1}{3} \times {@base@} \times {@h_1@} \\ &=\frac{1}{3} \times {@B_h@} \\ &={@ta@} \,\text{m}^3 \end{align} \)

Therefore, the amount of water the funnel can hold is \({@ta@}\,\text{m}^3\).
